Definition: A unique string with no spaces or special characters that will be used as id in the website.
Notes: Must be unique in the project.

Definition: The name of the corresponding file in the project’s objects directory.
Notes: Should have the extension (.jpg, .pdf, or .mp3), no spaces or special characters.

Definition: The YouTube ID of an item hosted on YouTube. This should be blank for all non-youtube items. It is used to access the YouTube API for images and video of the item.
Notes: You can find the ID of a YouTube video by looking at the end of a Share link, e.g. in https://youtu.be/CVXQ3X6Q8oU the ID is the string after the slash. Make sure this field is empty (no spaces!) for non-youtube items!

Definition: A name given to the game resource.
Notes: Primary name of the object.

Definition: The topic of the game resource.
Notes: Topics represented in the object, should use a controlled vocabulary. multiple subjects should be separated by a semi-colon.

Definition: An ambiguous reference to the resource within a given context. (OCA)
Notes: As an identifier for game-related materials, it has the URI's Encoding Scheme.

Definition: An entity primarily responsible for making the game resource.
Notes: Creator of the object. In general, we provide several creators using colons.

Definition: Players in game content.
Notes: Player of the game content. In general, we provide several creators using colons.

Definition: Performers of game-related content. (performance, music, etc.)
Notes: Performer of the object. In general, we provide several creators using colons.

Definition: A relay or commentator of game content.
Notes: Commentator of the object. In general, we provide several creators using colons.

Definition: An entity responsible for making the game resource available.
Notes: Publisher of the object. In general, we provide several publishers using colons.

Definition: The production company of the game covered by the content.
Notes: Contributor of the object. Describes the game manufacturer.

Definition: Distributors of games covered by this content.
Notes: Contributor of the object. Describes the game distributor.

Definition: Matters related to the subjectivity of the game.
Notes: Contributor of the object. Describes the game organizer.

Definition: Matters related to sponsorship of game matchs.
Notes: Contributor of the object. Describes the game sponsor.

Definition: A point or period of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the game resource.
Notes: Date of creation of original object, given in W3C-DTF format. In this simple project, please use only a single date.

Definition: The date of the game's play.
Notes: Date the game of the content was played, given in W3C-DTF format. In this simple project, please use only a single date.

Definition: A language of the game resource.
Notes: Language used in the object, ISO 639-2.

Definition: The nature or genre of the game resource.
Notes: The general genre of object, using the DCMI type vocabulary.

Definition: Medium in the digital file format of the resource.
Notes: Use for the digital format of the resource, form as an Internet Media Type (IMT) term. For multiple formats, separate values with a semicolon.

Definition: Extent of a resource's digital file format.
Notes: Use for the digital format of the resource, form as an Internet Media Type (IMT) term. For multiple formats, separate values with a semicolon.

Definition: The spatial topic of the resource, the spatial applicablity of the resource.
Notes: Spatial characteristics of what the object is about, subject-like locations and geographical terms. Using the ISO 3166-1.

Definition: The name of the game.
Notes: Free text description of the game name.

Definition: The genre of the game.
Notes: Free text description of the game genre.

Definition: A platform that offers the game.
Notes: Free text description of the game platform. For multiple platforms, separate values with a colon.

Definition: Name of the game character that appeared in the content.
Notes: Free text description of the game character. For multiple characters, separate values with a colon. You can write up to five things.
Example: Aatrox, Draven, Maokai, Pantheon, Poppy  etc.

Definition: Information about the copyright of the game resource.
Notes: Free text description of rights status.

Definition: The game resource from which the decribed resource is derived.
Notes: A standardized statement URI from http://rightsstatements.org/en/

Definition: An account of the game resource.
Notes: A free text description or abstract of the object. Anything significant about the digital resource not covered elsewhere. Use standard punctuation and grammar to describe the item’s history, physical appearance, contents, abstract, etc.
Example: Black and white photograph of white pines in forest

Definition: A related resource. (OCA)
Notes: A collection or aggregation that the item is part of, generally a specific collection and the source archives where the materials were digitized from.
